intro: Amischotolype neoscandens, commonly known as the Swedish bellflower, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to northern Europe. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with lance-shaped leaves that are hairy beneath. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland edges or stream banks. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens and conservation areas.
